text:
Hello Danny! It's 
me grandpa Jon.
I love you buddy.
What's 9+2?

No sorry bud.
9+2 is not 10

That's right!
9+2 equals 11
Great job buddy.

args.text:
Try to get the ice
block to the mark.

If you get stuck,
I'll reset it!

text:
Quack! Hi Danny
I'm a cave duck.
What's 4+7?

Quack!
That's wrong!
4+7 is not 10

Quack!
That's right!
4+7 equals 11

args.text:
Have you tried
using this radio?

Yeah it doesn't
fit does it?

But it's all I
have right now...

text:
Hi there Danny.
I'm your dad.
I love you.
Enjoy your youth.

args.text:
It is now safe to
turn off your
system.

text:
Hi Danny!
It's me daddy.

I'm driving 
the truck!

Where do you
want to go?

It looks like you
did all your math.

Hop on in,
let's go!

Looks like you
haven't done all
your math yet.
Talk to the dog!

Welcome to 
X Street!

Hi Danny! I'm your
neighbor Matt!
What's 6+7?

Woof!
That's wrong!
2+3 is not 4!

Woof!
That's right!
2+3 equals 5!

Look both ways
before crossing!

Hi there.
I'm just a truck.

Where would you
like to go?

It looks like you
did all your math.

Hop on in,
let's go!

Looks like you
haven't done all
your math yet.

Talk to animals
and people!

Welcome to the
Alpine Club!

This is grandpa's
magic cave...
It goes to space!

But unfortunately
it's locked.

You'll need to
find the key.

Maybe ask your
grandpa.
He loves space...

Hi there, I'm a
rock.

If you answer my
math question...
Be careful!

Don't play in 
the street!

Meow?
What's 2+3?

Meow!
That's wrong!
2+3 is not 4!

Meow!
That's right!
2+3 equals 5!

Hi Danny! I'm your
neighbor Matt!
What's 6+7?

Woof!
That's wrong!
2+3 is not 4!

Woof!
That's right!
2+3 equals 5!

Quack! Hi Danny
I'm a cave duck.
What's 4+7?

Quack!
That's wrong!
4+7 is not 10

Quack!
That's right!
4+7 equals 11

Quack! Hi Danny
I'm a cave duck.
What's 4+7?

Quack!
That's wrong!
4+7 is not 10

Quack!
That's right!
4+7 equals 11

Quack! Hi Danny
I'm a cave duck.
What's 4+7?

Quack!
That's wrong!
4+7 is not 10

Quack!
That's right!
4+7 equals 11

Woof! It's me
Frankie the dog.

I snuck in under
the fence...

But don't worry
I'm a good dog!

Anyway, I have
a question...
What's 2x3?

Woof!
That's wrong!
2+3 is not 4!

Woof!
That's right!
2+3 equals 5!

Quack! Hi Danny
I'm a cave duck.
What's 4+7?

Quack!
That's wrong!
4+7 is not 10

Quack!
That's right!
4+7 equals 11

Hi Danny!
I'm the heart.

I pump blood all
over your body.

And never stop
beating.

Anyway, I have
a question...

What bones
protect me?

No, I don't live
in your skull...

That's right! I
live in your ribs!
Good job!

My other body
friends will be
here soon...
Bye for now!

Welcome to the
organ room.

Organs are the
things inside you.

They digest food
and move blood
and let you see.

And everything
else that makes
you alive.

They are all made
of tiny cells that
are also alive.

Even your brain is
an organ!

Anyway answer all
their questions.

Then you can 
move on to the 
next room!

Hi there I'm
an eyeball.

It's nice to see
you again.

I'm sorry that's 
an eyeball joke.

Anyway I'm a very
important organ.

I use special
cells called rods
and cones to see!

They are sensative
to light.

And they send
information to
your brain.

I also have a
lense that you see
in front.

It looks like a
black circle but 
it's really clear!

The inside of me
just looks black.

Because my rods
and cones absorb
all the light!

Also I look like a
circle but I'm 
really a sphere.

I could say a lot
more, I'm a very
cool organ.

But I have a
question for you.

Where do my rods
and cones live?

That's right,
great job!

The retina is
inside me along
my back wall.

It's a thin layer 
of tissue that is

sensitive to 
light.

And it's where 
all my rods and 
cones live!

They're cool
little dudes.
Anyway great job!

Come see me again 
some time.

Sorry that was
another eyeball
joke...

No that's
not right!

The cornea is a
thick clear layer
of the eye.

It protects the
lens which is very
important.

The lens bends
light like
binoculars.

And makes things
look smaller.

So they fit on the
retina for the
rods and cones.

So when you look
at the black
circle on an eye.

You're looking
through the cornea
and the lens.

And seeing the
retina inside
someone's eye!

The cornea is also
very tough.

Because it has an
important job.

To protect
the eye!

Anyway try to
answer my question
again.

You'll get it
right next time!

Hi there, I'm lung
number one.
I breath for you.

And I bring oxygen
from the air to
your blood.

And blood brings
nutrients to every
cell in your body.

Your blood needs
oxygen to move
nutrients.

It's complicated
but very important

Anyway I haven't
thought of a good
question yet.

I'm probably over
thinking it...

But check back
soon!

Hi there I'm 
lung number two.

It's my day off
today.

Try talking to
lung number one.
Hi there.
I'm the liver.

I pronounce it
live-her.

But you can say it
however you want.

I help filter bad
stuff out of your
blood.

So you can feel
healthy.

Anyway I haven't
thought of a 
question yet.

But I'll think of
a good one soon.
I'm just sleepy...

Should I take a
nap on the couch?

Yeah, you're right
I should sleep...

I'll see you
later...

Yeah I'll sleep
later...

Welcome. This is
just a break room.

Help yourself to
a snack or juice.
No rush.

Hello, I'm the
other eyeball.

I'm not very
talkative.

I'm just taking a
break here.
I needed a snack.

You should talk
to the other eye.
He talks a lot...

Hey there, I'm
trying to nap...

I can't fall
asleep though...

I'll just be
patient and close
my eyes...
And breath slowly.

And think about my
day...

Hi there! I'm
the skull!

People think I'm
scary but I'm not.

I'm a really
friendly dude.

And I'm a really
important bone!

Actually I'm two
bones because of
my jaw bone.

And speaking of
my jaw bone...

Half of my teeth
live in my jaw!

And that 
reminds me...

I have a question
for you!

How many teeth do
adults have?

No, but you 
were close!

Try again, you'll
get it right
next time!

That's right,
Great job!

Adult skulls have
32 teeth usually.

16 on top and 16
on the bottom.

Teeth live in
your skull but
they aren't bones.

They're made of
different stuff.

They don't fix
themselves if they
break like bones.

And they're only 
for chewing.

Your other bones
don't chew!

Also did you know
there's no bone in
your nose?

It's made of
cartilage.

Cartilage isn't as
hard as bone.

It's bendy so it
doesn't break as
easily.
Anyway good job!

And remember I'm
not scary!

Welcome to the
skeleton room.

Your skeleton is
made of bones

They're hard and
tough like wood.

Not squishy like
your organs.

And they're mostly
not made of cells.

They're mostly
made of collagen
and minerals.

So bones aren't
alive in like your
organs are.

But your bones 
still have some
cells.

Anyway answer all
their questions.

Then you can 
move on to the 
next room!
Hmmm...

Let me think of a
good question...

Do you remember
how many bones are
in your arm?

That's right
great job!

No that's 
not right!

Your arm has three
bones in it.

The big one close
to your shoulder
is the humerous

The two smaller
ones close to your
hand are...

The radius and the
ulna!

The radius and
ulna are thinner.

And they are right
next to eachother.

Your humerous is
by itself.

Also remember
there are two arms

So that's six arm
bones all together

two humerous bones
two radius bones
and two ulna bones

The arm bones do
a lot of work.

Lots of moving
around...
Hey hey hey!

I'm your hand
bones!

Your hand has 27
bones in it.
Isn't that crazy?

Your finger bones
are called carpals
and phalanges.

You have 19 
finger bones.

Your phalanges
are right at your 
finger tips.

Your wrist has 8
bones in it.

You can call your
wrist your carpus.

You can't go to
the next room yet!
It's not ready.

Check back again
soon!
